item.title: 24-page suicide note and a letter titled ... goes missing from the Google Drive shared by the Bengaluru t - The Times of India
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie's Suicide Note and Letter Go Missing from Google Drive

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Atul Subhash, a 34-year-old techie from Bengaluru, tragically took his life, stating harassment by his estranged wife as a reason. He left behind a 24-page suicide note that has disappeared from a Google Drive link shared by him, raising allegations of a cover-up.

  • Atul Subhash's tragic death is linked to alleged harassment by his estranged wife and her family.
  • A video and a 24-page suicide note were initially accessible but have now gone missing from a shared Google Drive.
  • Social media users have accused law enforcement of covering up evidence related to the case.
  • Nikita Singhania, Subhash's wife, was arrested along with her mother and brother as investigations continue.
“Looks like they have removed the main note which had the ALL MAIN proofs.” - A Reddit user commenting on the missing files.

The disappearance of critical documents raises serious questions about transparency and the investigation into Subhash's death.

item.title: Ustad Zakir Hussain tribute: Tabla loses its vibrant voice - The Hindu
item.description:
Ustad Zakir Hussain tribute: Tabla loses its vibrant voice

Published Date & Source: December 16, 2024

The tabla fell silent as Ustad Zakir Hussain, one of the greatest ambassadors of Indian classical music, passed away on December 16, 2024, after a brief illness in San Francisco, California. He transformed the modest tabla into a voice for universal peace and humanity.

  • Hussain was renowned for his speed, dexterity, and creativity, mesmerizing audiences worldwide.
  • He played a crucial role in popularizing the tabla on a global scale.
  • A child prodigy, he gave his first professional performance at the age of 12.
  • Among his notable achievements are three Grammy Awards received in one night.
  • Hussain blended musical traditions, collaborating with artists across various genres and cultures.
  • He was also an actor, famously appearing in commercials that brought classical music into mainstream culture.
“I haven’t played good enough to quit.”

Ustad Zakir Hussain’s legacy will continue to inspire future generations of musicians and audiences as a testament to the power of music.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates: Rain Stops Play Again As Pant, Rahul Look To Rescue India - NDTV Sports
item.description:
IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score Updates

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

India's match against Australia has been significantly affected by rain. After losing key wickets, Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul have come together to stabilize the innings.

  • Australia set a strong total of 445 in their first innings.
  • Virat Kohli disappointed again, out for just 3 runs.
  • KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant are currently at the crease as India faces mounting pressure.
  • The match has been interrupted multiple times due to rain.
"This Test is turning out to be a disaster for both Team India and fans."

The ongoing match is crucial for both teams as they strive for dominance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Anurag Thakur Hits Ton As Lok Sabha Beats Rajya Sabha In Charity Cricket Match - NDTV
item.description:
Anurag Thakur Hits Ton As Lok Sabha Beats Rajya Sabha In Charity Cricket Match

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: NDTV

In a friendly cricket match aimed at raising awareness about Tuberculosis (TB), Anurag Thakur led the Lok Sabha team to victory against the Rajya Sabha team, scoring an unbeaten 111 runs.

  • Anurag Thakur captained the Lok Sabha Speaker XI team.
  • The match focused on spreading awareness about TB, coinciding with India's goal to eliminate the disease by 2025.
  • Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla inaugurated the match, and prizes were distributed by Union Minister Piyush Goyal.
  • The Lok Sabha team scored 251 runs, and the Rajya Sabha team managed 178 runs.
  • Anurag Thakur was awarded Man of the Match for his performance.
“We have to make India TB free by 2025 and this friendly match will work to spread awareness about TB eradication.” - Om Birla

The match successfully brought attention to the cause, echoing the efforts to combat TB and foster unity among MPs.

item.title: After Backlash On Bail 'Celebrations', Allu Arjun's Post For Injured Boy - NDTV
item.description:
After Backlash On Bail 'Celebrations', Allu Arjun's Post For Injured Boy

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Telugu actor Allu Arjun expresses deep concern for Sri Tej, a boy critically injured in a stampede at a Hyderabad theater screening of 'Pushpa 2'. Following backlash for celebrating his bail, Arjun emphasizes his support for the boy and his family during this difficult time.

  • On December 4, a stampede occurred when Allu Arjun made an unscheduled visit to a theater showing 'Pushpa 2'.
  • Tragically, a woman died and her son, Sri Tej, suffered critical injuries during the incident.
  • Allu Arjun cannot visit the boy due to ongoing legal proceedings but expressed his prayers and commitment to assist with medical and family needs.
  • His previous social media celebrations after being granted bail faced backlash online.
  • Sri Tej is currently receiving medical care and is in stable but serious condition.
“I remain deeply concerned about young Sri Tej, who is under constant medical care after the unfortunate incident. My prayers remain with them and I remain committed to taking responsibility for addressing the medical and family needs.” - Allu Arjun

The incident raises questions about crowd management and responsibilities of celebrities during public appearances, highlighting the need for better safety protocols at events.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates: Virat Kohli Flops Again, Big India Collapse On Cards - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates: Virat Kohli Flops Again, Big India Collapse On Cards

Date: Not specified
Source: NDTV Sports

As the 3rd Test between India and Australia progresses into Day 3, Virat Kohli's performance has been under scrutiny again amid fears of a possible collapse for the Indian team.

  • India faces the prospect of a significant collapse.

"Kohli's recent performances have raised concerns among fans and analysts alike."

The ongoing match highlights the challenges faced by the Indian team, particularly with Kohli's current form being less than impressive. Fans are eagerly awaiting how the team adapts moving forward.

item.title: Bitcoin rises to record after longest weekly winning run since 2021 - The Times of India
item.description:
Bitcoin rises to record after longest weekly winning run since 2021

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Financial Times

Bitcoin has achieved a new record following its longest weekly winning streak since 2021, indicating renewed investor confidence in the cryptocurrency market.

  • Bitcoin has risen in value significantly over the past week.
  • This marks the longest stretch of positive performance for Bitcoin since 2021.
  • The rise is attributed to increasing institutional interest and favorable market conditions.
“This performance signals a potential shift in the market sentiment towards cryptocurrencies,” said an industry analyst.

The recent surge in Bitcoin’s price may suggest a broader recovery in the cryptocurrency sector, attracting more investors and stakeholders.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena nominates Karan Veer Mehra; says ‘main tera dost nahi hu’ - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena nominates Karan Veer Mehra; says ‘main tera dost nahi hu’

Publication Date: [date unspecified] Source: Times of India

In the upcoming episode of Bigg Boss 18, relationships are set to shift dramatically during the nomination task as Vivian Dsena makes a bold move.

  • Vivian Dsena nominates Karan Veer Mehra and Shilpa Shirodkar, ending his friendship with Karan.
  • During the nomination, Vivian declared, “Dosti, frenemy, let me make it clear… main tera dost nahi hu.”
  • Nouran, Vivian's wife, criticized him for being too loyal and not assertive enough.
  • The nominations could lead to major shifts in house dynamics and confrontations.
“You having a soft corner for him boils my blood. He’s been using you since the third week.” - Nouran

This decisive move by Vivian signals a turning point in the game as fans eagerly await the upcoming developments.

item.title: 6 Mesmerising Images Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
item.description:
6 Mesmerising Images Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Times Now

This article showcases six stunning images of stars captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, revealing the beauty and complexity of the universe.

  • ESO 245-5: A crowded star field showing a large part of a galaxy, located 15 million light-years away.
  • Star AU Microscopii: Featuring a young planet and its dynamic relationship with a red dwarf star.
  • Stellar Cradle: Showcases the protostellar object OH 339.88-1.26, filled with dusty lanes and bright stars.
  • NGC 346: Depicts an active area of star formation within the Small Magellanic Cloud.
  • Stargazing In NGC 6355: Illustrates the globular cluster located within our Milky Way galaxy.
“Scientists were surprised to observe young stars spiraling towards the core of a large star cluster within the Small Magellanic Cloud.”

This remarkable collection of images highlights the wonders of astronomy and encourages further exploration of the cosmos.

item.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion: Upset MLAs, govt's reassurance & CM's ‘audit’ plan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion: Upset MLAs, govt's reassurance & CM's ‘audit’ plan

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Maharashtra cabinet expansion on Dec 16, 2024, added 39 new ministers, increasing its total count to 42. This move has caused discontent among some MLAs who were left out of the ministry.

  • The BJP received 19 ministerial positions, while the Shiv Sena took 11, and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) got 9.
  • Some prominent leaders, such as NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal and BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar, were not included in the cabinet.
  • Ajit Pawar announced that the first group of ministers would serve for two and a half years, allowing opportunity for others later.
“We will give an opportunity to others also for two-and-a-half years,” - Ajit Pawar

MLAs expressed disappointment over the cabinet selections, with some, like Ramdas Athawale from the Republican Party of India (A), demanding representation. Furthermore, Mahayuti allies agreed to undertake a performance audit of ministers soon.

item.title: Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Dies At 73, Confirms Family - NDTV
item.description:
Tributes Pour In As Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Passes Away At 73

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Unspecified News Source

Zakir Hussain, the celebrated tabla maestro, passed away due to complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. He is mourned by his family and music lovers worldwide.

  • Zakir Hussain died in a San Francisco hospital at the age of 73.
  • He was known as the greatest tabla player of his time, leaving behind a rich legacy.
  • Hussain had been hospitalized for two weeks prior to his death.
  • His collaborations with both Indian and international artists significantly influenced the world of music.
  • Hussain received multiple prestigious awards, including four Grammy Awards and several Padma honors.
  • Messages of condolence and tributes highlighted his humility and immense contributions to music.
“He leaves behind an extraordinary legacy cherished by countless music lovers around the globe.”

Hussain's impact on both Indian classical music and Western music through innovative collaborations is celebrated, with his influence expected to resonate for generations.

item.title: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain dies at 73 - The Hindu
item.description:
Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain Passes Away at 73

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: The Hindu

Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has passed away at the age of 73 due to complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  • He was hospitalized for the last two weeks before being moved to the ICU.
  • Hussain was a four-time Grammy Award winner, with three awards received at the 66th Grammy Awards earlier in 2024.
  • His career spanned six decades, collaborating with many renowned artists and blending Indian classical music with jazz.
  • He was awarded the Padma Shri in 1988, Padma Bhushan in 2002, and Padma Vibhushan in 2023.
“He defined the sound of the tabla and brought it into the international music scene.”

The passing of Zakir Hussain marks a significant loss for music lovers and the cultural landscape of India.

item.title: Farmers' tractor march today outside Punjab as stir at Shambhu border intensifies - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Farmers Organize Tractor March in Punjab Amid Protests

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The tractor march organized by farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher is part of escalating protests against the Indian government's actions. It follows police blockades against a group of farmers attempting to march towards Delhi, which led to tensions and injuries among the protesters.

  • Farmers are planning a tractor march outside Punjab on December 16 and a 'Rail Roko' in Punjab on December 18.
  • Security forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse farmers at the Shambhu border.
  • Seventeen farmers were reported injured, with some in serious condition.
  • Pandher criticized the government and opposition leaders for failing to address farmers' issues.
“The Indian government used force against 101 farmers. Seventeen farmers have been injured, many of whom are in serious condition.” - Sarwan Singh Pandher

Farmers continue to demand attention to their concerns as they organize protests, intensifying their efforts to make their voices heard.

item.title: ‘I’m not good enough': Pep Guardiola takes the blame as Manchester City lose to Manchester United - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pep Guardiola Takes Responsibility for Manchester City's Defeat to Manchester United

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pep Guardiola expressed his disappointment and took the blame for Manchester City's recent 2-1 defeat against Manchester United, marking a difficult period for the team.

  • Manchester City led the match with a goal from Josko Gvardiol.
  • Late goals from Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo sealed the win for Manchester United.
  • This loss signifies City's eighth defeat in 11 games, raising concerns about team performance.
  • Guardiola admitted he is struggling to find solutions and feels personally responsible for the team's struggles.
  • His recent two-year contract extension adds pressure to turn the team's fortunes around.
  • Ruben Amorim praised his team's performance and confidence in the win over City.
“I’m the manager and I’m not good enough, simple as that.” - Pep Guardiola

The defeat adds to the pressure on Guardiola as he attempts to restore Manchester City's form amidst growing concerns from fans and analysts alike.

item.description:
Shriram Finance's Venkatraman Discusses Trust and Digital Experiences

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

Recently, Shriram Finance Ltd launched a brand campaign featuring cricket legend Rahul Dravid, emphasizing trust and customer-centricity amidst a digital experience-driven market. Executive Director Elizabeth Venkatraman elaborates on the campaign’s strategy and brand priorities.

  • Focus on building consumer trust through engaging digital experiences.
  • Incorporation of sports metaphors to unify brand messaging.
  • Insights into the demands and expectations of Gen Z consumers.
  • The campaign aims to align with Shriram Finance's inclusive approach to marketing.
“In our sector, trust and credentials are key.” - Elizabeth Venkatraman

This campaign showcases Shriram Finance's commitment to meeting evolving customer expectations while enhancing its brand image.

item.title: Syria rebel leader meets U.N. envoy in Damascus - The Hindu
item.description:
Syria Rebel Leader Meets U.N. Envoy in Damascus

Published on: December 16, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Syrian Islamist leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, now using his real name Ahmed al-Sharaa, met with U.N. envoy Geir Pedersen in Damascus to discuss updates needed for a UN Security Council resolution, reflecting recent political changes.

  • Al-Jolani's group, Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), played a key role in changing Syria's political landscape.
  • The meeting focused on amending the U.N. Security Council Resolution 2254 to better match new realities in Syria.
  • HTS has historical ties to Al-Qaeda but has been working to rebrand itself since leaving Nusra Front in 2016.
  • Al-Jolani emphasized the importance of Syrian unity, reconstruction, and a safe environment for refugees.
  • Pedersen stressed the need for an inclusive political process led by Syrians.
“That process obviously needs to be led by the Syrians themselves” with “help and assistance” from the rest of the world.

This meeting marks a significant diplomatic engagement as Syria continues to navigate its complex political landscape in the aftermath of years of conflict.

Narayana Murthy Defends 70-Hour Workweek Philosophy, Says ‘800 Million Indians Get Free Ration…’

Publication Date: 16 Dec, 2024

Source: Mint

In his latest statements, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy reflects on the 70-hour workweek philosophy amidst rising discussions about economic welfare and labor practices in India.

  • Murthy shares insights on his journey, touching on his earlier political views during Nehru's leadership.
“800 million Indians get free ration…”

The discourse around work ethics and economic support in India continues to evolve as leaders like Murthy engage with these pressing issues.

item.title: ‘Kalaari Capital has seen more than $100 million in exits this year’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Kalaari Capital Exceeds $100 Million in Exits in 2023

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Kalaari Capital, led by Vani Kola, has reported over $100 million in exits during the current calendar year, while also investing around $25 million in more than 10 companies.

Key investments this year include Clean Electric, Lxme, Kindlife, Figr, and Convin. Kola highlighted that the firm has achieved an average of over 4x DPI return for some of its funds, with expectations of 5-6x returns for older funds.

  • Kalaari Capital has achieved over $100 million in exits in 2023.
  • Invested approximately $25 million in more than 10 companies this year.
  • Notable investments include Clean Electric, Lxme, Kindlife, Figr, and Convin.
  • Expectations of 5-6x returns for older funds.
“On an average, some of our funds have given over 4x DPI already.” - Vani Kola

This achievement reflects Kalaari Capital's position in the venture capital space and its potential for future growth.

item.title: Can we make black holes reveal themselves in echoes of light? - The Hindu
item.description:
Can we make black holes reveal themselves in echoes of light?

Published: December 16, 2024 05:30 am IST Source: The Hindu

This article examines recent research on light echoes around black holes, highlighting a new method for measuring their properties through effects on light, as reported by a Princeton University study.

  • The study proposes using light echoes as a new way to measure black hole masses and spins.
  • Light passing around black holes bends and can create multiple light paths, leading to echoes.
  • The research employs a technique called long-baseline interferometry to detect these echoes.
  • The study focuses on black holes in the Milky Way and M87 galaxies.
  • Preliminary simulations support the technique and align with Einstein's theory of relativity.
Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity predicted that light echoes would occur, implying that they should be observable across different frequencies.

The findings offer intriguing insights into black holes and could significantly enhance our understanding of their characteristics and behavior in the universe.
